name: sfchronicle
text:
Perhaps Joel Embiid, who shares an Under Armour sponsorship with Stephen Curry and considers the two-time MVP a good friend, represents the Warriors’ best shot at a big-name addition, writes @Con_Chron. 

https://t.co/S2fVpzWo7r

name: sfchronicle
text: Marin County Fire Department officials said the evacuation warning for Bolinas has been lifted in connection to the Woodward Fire. https://t.co/wVCmyQqUo2

name: sfchronicle
text:
One win from a first Northern California championship and two from a state crown, the Lincoln boys basketball team’s dream season was brought to a screeching halt by the coronavirus. 

https://t.co/Ofd4TIA0T8

name: sfchronicle
text: Santa Clara County public health officials reported 204 new coronavirus cases on Saturday, bringing the county’s case total to 17,013 cases. The county’s death tally remained unchanged on Saturday at 244 deaths. https://t.co/f3lbAYAyEb

name: sfchronicle
text:
With shortstop Marcus Semien a late scratch in Game 2, the A’s dropped both ends of a doubleheader at Houston on Saturday, and the Astros trimmed Oakland’s lead in the AL West to 2 1/2 games.

https://t.co/aY7dqeOApR

name: sfchronicle
text:
The Giants ended their skid at three games by knocking off the Diamondbacks 5-2. 

“I really do believe that this is an exploration process with our bullpen,” said manager Gabe Kapler. “We’re really still in the phase of learning about these guys.”

https://t.co/eFbgEiw4Qp

name: sfchronicle
text:
Antonio Cahilig, a Muni operator who had been with the transportation agency for 19 years, died early Saturday morning after falling “severely ill” while on duty, Muni officials said.

https://t.co/tjMVMxva69

name: sfchronicle
text: BREAKING: A demonstration in Oakland turned violent Saturday night, with police saying that protesters were throwing rocks and “using shields to assault officers.” https://t.co/JpoDR7is8z

name: sfchronicle
text: Police said they declared the crowd blocking traffic on Mandana Avenue as unlawful assembly and said they failed to disperse, saying protesters needed to leave or “face possible arrest.” https://t.co/tXk2jjLPZy

name: sfchronicle
text:
Latest on the largest wildfires burning in in Northern California: 

- #LNULightningComplex: 373,920 acres, 55% contained 
- #SCULightningComplex  376,471 acres, 45% contained 
- #CZULightningComplex: 84,338 acres, 33% contained 

Fire Tracker >>> https://t.co/RM8Pao8VyL

name: sfchronicle
text:
It was another turbulent week of American life that jangled nerves and tested spirits — a mix of disaster, disease, racial tension and political divisions. 

Is this a moment to be seized, or is 2020 a year to be survived?

https://t.co/h9uZ42z0Av

name: sfchronicle
text: Oakland police and protesters clashed for a third night this week on Saturday, as a march that began peacefully turned combative and resulted in deployment of tear gas and arrest of six demonstrators. https://t.co/SodzZtghPE

name: sfchronicle
text: ICYMI: An officer was injured and 6 people were arrested in Oakland Saturday night after a march that began peacefully turned combative and resulted in deployment of tear gas. https://t.co/DNWyOruylC

text: Today's front page: the stories San Francisco is talking about this morning. https://t.co/sgK7iFvtYo https://t.co/7N3Rglzyoj

text:
Recent data found that dialysis patients have the highest rate of COVID-19 hospitalizations of all Medicare beneficiaries, at 1,340 per 100,000 recipients — eight times the rate of the average recipient.

https://t.co/RHEUmbdxYO

name: sfchronicle
text:
Morning update on #CZULightningComplex in Santa Cruz and San Mateo counties:

 - 84,640 acres
 - 35% contained
 - 1 fatality 
 - 1 injury
 - 1,177 structures destroyed
 - 125 structures damaged
 - 9,374 structures still threatened

The latest >> https://t.co/DhyRMEmVF1

name: sfchronicle
text:
RT @peterhartlaub: I dove into the @sfchronicle archive to see what happened to movies, live theater, museums and parades after the so-called 1918 Spanish flu ended.

It was a reassuring journey, filled with sold out playhouses, new construction and way too much drinking.

https://t.co/w8yhB5k7g6

Carmel Fire
 - 6,905 acres
 - 86% contained 
 - 73 structures destroyed, 7 damaged

text: Inside Lands effectively captured the disorienting, high-energy feel of the @sfoutsidelands typically hosted in SF’s Golden Gate Park. It also managed to reflect the mood of the moment, writes @MusicSF. https://t.co/KDI3Qlk9d7

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: San Francisco reports 79 new coronavirus cases, bringing its total to 9,428. No new deaths were reported. https://t.co/gMWW5tt3NC

name: sfchronicle
text:
RT @demianbulwa: Staggering numbers in @philmatier piece on downtown SF becoming ghost town

--Credit card transactions: Down 80% in Financial District

--BART riders getting off at 2 main stations: Down from 98,000 workday exits to 6,000

-- High-rise occupancy: Down 90%
https://t.co/e0w3muwO6b

name: sfchronicle
text: A helicopter scan at SF’s former bases was "extremely unlikely" to reveal radioactivity because it wasn't sensitive enough to do so. The city relied on it anyway for years to calm people's fears about living amid toxic waste. https://t.co/leUSQZudtc

name: sfchronicle
text:
RT @dustingardiner: Right now: Senate debating AB1080, landmark bill that would phase out use of plastic packaging and single-use items.

Plastics industry, aka Californians for Recycling and the Environment, has spent heavily on lobbying, Facebook ads this week.

Background: https://t.co/GlYBtpq0v5

text: JUST IN: Cal Fire has lifted evacuation orders for parts of Napa County, downgrading them to evacuation warnings, as the #LNULightningComplex fires burn nearby. https://t.co/l27wDSZT7D

name: sfchronicle
text:
SF ordered an inaccurate radiation scan of Hunters Point and Treasure Island — knowing the scan was bogus — and then touted the results for years to argue that the sites are safe & should be developed.

@jfagone and @cdizikes have the story >> https://t.co/hkV8ayODDm

name: sfchronicle
text: @peterhartlaub The Bay Area has long been a place of comers and goers. But the pandemic has made this dynamic more acute. It’s also left people wondering who will be left in their communities. https://t.co/Q9lDy20di7

text:

Following strict COVID-19 safety measures, @Metallica filmed a concert at Sonoma's Gundlach Bundschu Winery a few weeks ago. Here's how to watch: https://t.co/ZU6pGKAT6P

name: sfchronicle
text: @peterhartlaub @sarahfeldberg In this letter from a post-pandemic 2030, author @caroderobertis says that we don’t have to fear change. This isn’t some dystopian future where all is lost. Those old narratives are so lazy. https://t.co/1dJC55Xgiy

name: sfchronicle
text:
RT @meganrcassidy: “Yet at the same time, this is so empowering, motivating, invigorating for me. We have never been in a place like this.”

An inspiring take on a year like 2020. 

https://t.co/oc3aaPkb8S

text: Is 2020 a year to forget — or one to be seized? https://t.co/PORHezhyxK

text: A’s shortstop Marcus Semien, whose consecutive games played streak ended at 275 on Saturday, isn’t expected to go onto the injured list after an MRI showed that his left-side soreness isn’t serious. https://t.co/K3oQ3jN6rQ
